SEARCH
Package com.ecoguard.ecoguard.controller

Class ThresholdController

java.lang.Object
com.ecoguard.ecoguard.controller.ThresholdController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/admin/thresholds") public class ThresholdController extends Object
REST controller for managing environmental threshold configurations.

Provides endpoints for CRUD operations on thresholds, which define acceptable ranges for each metric type (Temperature, Humidity, CO2, Light). When thresholds are updated, the system automatically sends a REFRESH_CONFIG command to the ESP32 device and logs the change in the audit trail.

All endpoints require ADMIN role authentication.

Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • getAllThresholds

      @GetMapping public List<Threshold> getAllThresholds()
      Retrieves all threshold configurations.
      Returns:
      list of all thresholds in the system

    • getThresholdById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Threshold> getThresholdById(@PathVariable("id") Long id)
      Retrieves a threshold by its unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the threshold ID to look up
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the threshold if found, or 404 Not Found

    • getByMetric

      @GetMapping("/by-metric/{metricType}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Threshold> getByMetric(@PathVariable MetricType metricType)
      Retrieves the threshold configuration for a specific metric type.
      Parameters:
      metricType - the metric type (TEMP, HUMIDITY, CO2, or LIGHT)
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the threshold if found, or 404 Not Found

    • update

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> update(@PathVariable("id") Long id, @RequestBody ThresholdPayload payload, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Updates an existing threshold configuration.

      Updates the min/max values for a threshold and automatically:

      • Logs the change in the audit trail with username and timestamp
      • Sends a REFRESH_CONFIG command to the ESP32 device
      Parameters:
      id - the threshold ID to update
      payload - the new threshold values (minValue and/or maxValue)
      request - HTTP request containing the authentication session
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the updated threshold, or 404 Not Found

    • recentAudits

      @GetMapping("/audit") public List<ThresholdAuditResponse> recentAudits()
      Retrieves the most recent threshold change history.

      Returns the last 10 threshold modifications, ordered by update time descending. Used for displaying threshold change history in the admin panel.

      Returns:
      list of the 10 most recent threshold audit records

    • delete

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> delete(@PathVariable("id") Long id)
      Deletes a threshold configuration by ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the threshold ID to delete
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with 204 No Content on success
